column2: Her voice was soft, but her words rang like a drum. Word of a prophet who has directly spoken to our ancestors have spread to us. She speaks of the return of of our ancestors to the mortal realm and the enlightenment of our people. The words of this young girl have penetrated the minds of our people. If we are to accept her ideas, our people would be pleased, but if we were to ignore, our people would be engraged.
Word has spread of a Xhosa prophet. Most have rejected her ideas, and feel threatened by the radicalized nation on our borders.
There has been a heightened interest in learning and creating among our people thanks to the prophet's relentless teachings.

A band of warriors have crossed into Zulu territory and have stolen a large amount of cattle in the name of the prophet. She has stated that she never told them to do so, but doesn't condemn their actions. We are yet to receive a Zulu response.
This can only be good for our people.
The Xhosa have cross the border and stole our cattle. We must take immediate action.
This is unacceptable. We will take back what is ours!

The wedding had been planned for months. Some people opposed the idea of King Sandile marrying the prophet, calling it a simple power grab, while the chief states tthat it was the prophet's idea in the first place. Despite the protests, the ceremony was grand. The feast had lasted for hours. The marriage between the prophet and the King had cemented the new beliefs of our people.

Today is a day of mourning and grief. Mgolobane Sandile of Rharhabe, chief of the Xhosa, was found dead in his home. He was young, and his death is still wrapped in mystery. Some say he died due to untreated injuries. Others say he was poisoned. He was childless, so our people have looked at the prophet for leadership, which she, in her grace, has accepted. This could be a silver lining for our people.

1000 cattle were gathered for slaughter. Weeping could be heard from peak to peak. The prophet is dead. Her health had been waning, but we weren't expect such a sudden death. We shall mourn her for decades.
The prophet has suggested that we conquer the Zulu and teach them her ways, and why shouldn't we? It will be done

Her health is waning. If we are to continue her teachings, we need to adopt new methods of teaching. Our scholars have already learnt themselves in the Scot's script. If we were to translate it to our language, our ability to teach our youth would greatly increase.
The governing systems of old aren't sustainable for a country of our size. The prophet, in her grace, has planned out a new administration that can handle the size of our nation.
Our conquests will not stop at Zulu. We shall unite all Mzansi under our teachings.
One does not achieve greatness by pretending to be great. We have united the South under our teachings. May we be eternal. Umzansi ungunaphakade!
We are surrounded by lands that are ripe for the taking, and filled with people that would be happy under our control. We must claim these areas.

We have been contacted by members of the liberation movement of Tsonga, currently living under the dominion of a neighboring country. There is an opportunity to stir up sentiment among those living there so that they may rise up and weaken our enemy. There is, of course, a risk that our efforts could be discovered and bring war down upon us.

We have been contacted by members of the liberation movement of Arbota, currently living under the dominion of a neighboring country. There is an opportunity to stir up sentiment among those living there so that they may rise up and weaken our enemy. There is, of course, a risk that our efforts could be discovered and bring war down upon us.
We hold provinces that Tsonga has claims on. Returning these provinces, as an act of good faith, would surely bolster our relations.
We hold provinces that Arbota has claims on. Returning these provinces, as an act of good faith, would surely bolster our relations.

The death of Fanomezantsoa, the chief of Arbota, made his fragile chiefdom descend in a spiral of chaos as his sons, Mzila and Mawewe, fight for the throne. Soshangane's armies, that once overran the Portuguese settlements at Delagoa Bay, Inhambane and Sena, now turn their gaze inwards as the chiefdom slowly edges towards civil war. It goes without saying that this represents an optimal opportunity to take some of these lands back, and several individuals in the colonies already began to take advantage of this situation.
We have been divided by our political differences, but now, we shall reunite under one banner. Ours.

Today is a day of mourning and grief. Mgolobane Sandile of Rharhabe, chief of the Xhosa, was found dead in his home. He was young, and his death is still wrapped in mystery. Some say he died due to untreated injuries. Others say he was poisoned. He was childless, leaving many to claim the Xhosa throne. Three main factions have arisen. The Rharhabe, the current ruling faction, who have put the chief's favoured wife, the queen regent, in power. The Gcaleka, the main opposition to the Rulers. They claim that the Rharhabe have been too soft on the foreigners, and that the Rharhabe are too weak to bring Xhosa to greatness. The Ndlambe. The weakest of the three, supported by those who wish for Xhosa to change with the world around it, instead of remainig a backwater.

Today is a day of mourning and grief. Mgolobane Sandile of Rharhabe, chief of the Xhosa, was found dead in his home. He was young, and his death is still wrapped in mystery. Some say he died due to untreated injuries. Others say he was poisoned. He was the greatest ruler in our history. Our future rulers have big shoes to fill.
The queen regent has failed to keep Xhosa society together. Local Rulers have pledged loyalties to different factions. The Rharhabe rule has ended.
I want to play as the Rharhabe!
I want to play as the Gcaleka!
I want to play as the Ndlambe!

Rubha Ùr is under our control. Now is the time to sit down with our former colonial masters at Neamhnaid, a town known for its beautiful views (which will, hopefully, distract their diplomats), and work out a peace deal that will see it transferred into Datiach hands.
We have retaken New Rubha from the Datiach. It is time to restore our old colony.
Recently, fighting has broken out between our garrisons in the colony and the Datiach, the mixed race people of New Rubha.

The situation in New Rubha has grown to a serious problem. A group of Datiach rebels have stormed the colonial office in Heidtoun and have sent us a list of ridiculous demands, including full independence and guarentees to not return to the colony.
Surely we can negotiate a settlement that everyone can agree with?
We shall stomp this rebellion before ideas of independence in our other colonial dominions spread!
What will we tell the Datiach?
They will gain equal rights with as the Scots in New Rubha.
They will be allowed to return to their normal lives under our rule.
The Datiach rebels have conceded in the negotiations. Life shall return to normal in New Rubha
The Datiach rebels have agreed to our terms. Peace shall be restored to the colony.

The Datiach have demanded our surrender, and, truth is, we can't deny it. They have held Heidtoun against our forces. This war has been an embarrassment on the world stage. Our best bet is to attmpt to rekindle relations with the Datiach and create an ally out of them. We could also denounce the Datiach and try to retake Rubha Ùr.

The Datiach rebels of Rubha Ùr have embarrassed the Scots. They have forced them to sign the Treaty of Neamhnaid, securing Datiach independence. From now on, the stability of the Scottish Colonial Empire isn't guarenteed.
The Scots have lost Rubha Ùr to Datiach rebels. The colony revolted against their rule and have forced a peace with the Scots.
The Scots have lost Rubha Ùr to Datiach rebels.
We should rekindle relations with the Datiach.
We should attempt to retake New Rubha.
We have achieved victory over the Scots. They have accepted our terms, and they seem to be attempting to rekindle relations with us. Perhaps they could become a useful ally in future.

We have achieved victory over the Scots. They have reluctantly accepted our terms. This does not mean that our independence is guarenteed, however. We must remain vigilant for future incursions if we wish to keep of freedom.
The Low German merchants of Heidtoun are syphoning funds from our Eastern colonies, away from our treasury.
With the construction of the Suez Canal, the Merchants of Heidtoun have become increasingly irrelevant. It seems that the solution to this issue was simply patience.
It all seems to have worked out!
We have inherited New Rubha's owner's problems with the Rubhach-German Merchants. They will syphon our funds from the trade routes between East and West.
What are we to do with the Merchants?
Bar their companies from the port. Of course, they will be compensated  accordingly.
Nationalize their companies, they have stolen enough from us.
Those bastards will pay for their crimes against us.
The Rubhach-German Merchants have long stolen our country's wealth from the trade between east and west. It is time to discuss what we shall do with the Merchants.

With the introduction of European and Columbian crops and farming methods, and the sparse amount of people, the population of Southern Africa has begun to explode. We are yet to see how this will effect the region, but this could open many oppurtunites for us.
Our old prophet has led us down this path. We must complete it. We shall break the boundries between the heavens.
We must purify our lands and peoples in preparation for the merging of the heavens and Earth. Now all there is to do is wait.
The Xhosa and us have ended our petty squabbles. It is time to stand united against the Zulu.
And we'll bask in glory, victory or not.
The Tsonga and us have ended our petty squabbles. It is time to stand united against the Zulu.
And we'll bask in glory, victory or not.
The time for war has come. We have prepared what we can, but we can prepare no longer. The longer we wait, the stronger, more consolidated the Zulu become. We have to attack now.
Perhaps war isn't the right option...
We have lost. We are humiliated. But we will return. Aphile maZulu!.
We have lost, and our future is uncertain, but we still remain. They have been leniant on us, and they will regret it.
The Arbotsy living in our land have revolted under their deposed king. We suspect that the Pedi are behind this.
They have marched on our villages. they have taken our cattle. We are defeated. But we will return, one day.
Our subjects our revolting, our soldiers are deserting and furthur the Zulu have marched. We have lost.
We have bested the Bapedi and their sly tools. Our neighbours, and the Scots, see our might. IKwaZulu iyabusa!

The rise of the Zulu may have given us our freedom against our Ndebele oppressors, but their continued existance is a threat to our freedom. If we are to survive, we must act, and we shouldn't act alone.
I can think of many who would fight against the Zulu.
The Arbota have lost their freedom at home, but  we can win it for them in Manjakazi. Their remaining forces are weak, and will need supplies, but their numbers and desperation could prove useful.
The Xhosa have long been rivals of the Zulu. They lay claim to their southern lands, now could be their oppurtunity for victory.
The Tsonga are currently facing internal strife and divison. A victory against the most powerful army in the region could bring the unity they desire.
The Arbota have accepted our proposal, but time will tell if they stick to their part of the deal.
The Bapedi have invited us to a coalition against the Zulu, with the promise of eThekwini as a reward. What should we respond with?
The Xhosa have accepted to the proposal. Our coalition grows greater.
The Xhosa have refused our offer. It seems that our battle will be more difficult.
The Bapedi have invited us to a coalition against the Zulu, with the promise of Tsaneng and Manjakazi as a reward. What should we respond with?
The Tsonga have accepted to the proposal. Our coalition grows greater.
The Tsonga have refused our offer. It seems that our battle will be more difficult.

We are tactically inferior to the Zulu, but we have the advantage of the Scots and their weaponry. It's clear that they want a weak Zululand, and a weak Zululand is what we'll give them, if they accept our offer.
The Scottish are more experienced with their guns than we are. It's a great, yet expensive idea to hire their mercenaries as generals.
It is time for our subjects pass the folds to be integrated into our country proper.
With our control of the lands of Khoehubaib, we can name it accordingly.
With our control of the lands of Khoehubaib, we can name it accordingly.
The coalition war against the Zulu has started.
We have managed to best the Xhosa in the short term, perhaps it would be best to bail out now and not risk furthur escalation.
No, we will sieze this oppurtunity for complete victory!
We have managed to best Drummond in the short term, perhaps it would be best to bail out now and not risk furthur escalation.
No, we will sieze this oppurtunity for complete victory!

Our republic, born out of pioneers brave enough to venture into the unknown, brave enough to face the hardships of leaving what we know, into the isolation of our new home, brave enough to face those who might tread on our independence. Our border to the east has always been one of tesnion and unease, defined by the Great Kariega, but our hand has been forced, and to war we must go. It is of greatest importance to our survival that we beat the Xhosa and their heathen king, but under the leadership of our great president, Morven Stewart, we shall succeed.
We have achieved total victory in Drummond. Now is the time for celebration!
We have achieved total victory in Qariega. Now is the time for celebration!
What to do With the Drummonders?
The Drummonders' Republic is of our creation, and it is time for them to return. We must send an ultimatum to them, demanding annexation.
We have consolidatedour strength, and now we are finally able to expand to our rightfull land in the north.
The powers in Heidtoun have demanded our annexation to them. How should we respond!
Of course, it is our duty!
The damned cattlemen and their dastardly president have refused annexation! We will act accordingly!
The powers in Heidtoun have demanded our annexation to them. How should we respond!
Of course, it is our duty!
column14: Of course, it is our duty!

column2: Those rotten herders have refused annexation! We will act accordingly!
Tsonga has been built on lies and empty promises that we are unable to fulfill, and we are starting to face the consequences of this.
The Kariban bandits in our north have made life difficult for both our soldiers and civilians.
The Foreign powers in Heidtoun and Tananarive are meddling with our markets and politics.
Our leaders see the pointlessness of working at their full competence, as we are unable to supply them with sufficient rewards.

The Second Vatsonga Empire, as it has been called, has little to do with the Tsonga of old, which are all but extinct and assimilated into the modern Tsonga population. The empire has been built in less than a decade, not because of its impressive military, great leadership, or strong economy. It was built by the desperation of its people, being surrounded on all sides by powerful enemies, with no unity, being fed lies by an ambitious clan who happened to be in the right place at the right time. But now, the empire of empty promises is facing the consequences of its actions. It has no proper systems to gain wealth from its people, no methods of dealing with the new waves of bantus, no ways of dealing with foreign powers meddling with its politics, and no ways of paying its leaders their fair due. We must act fast if Tsonga is to survive, or we will simply be a distant memory of a worse time.
Noma a we taleriwi hi nambu.

The Kariban bandits in the north have harassed us for far too long, we must put an end to this. We will use all means available to stop these scum. §RYou must keep all units in the listed provinces, and keep funding up, for at most, 1 year. Otherwise, the pacification will fail, and you'll have to start again.
We have managed to pacify the bandits in the north. One step closer to a stable Tsonga.
Due to the lack of persistent effort against the bandits, they have reasserted control in the north.

Our leadership is in a sorry state. We need to invest in our leadership structures. We will succeed, no matter how much it costs. §GYou must have 10% civilization progress, NOT 50%, to take this decision.
We must prepare to reclaim diplomatic independence from the Scots and Imerina, whether through hard or soft power.
The Scots have overly influenced our trade, and have supported seperatists and pretenders within our country. We must stop this.
The Imerina have long been our main rival, and have used any method to weaken us. We must stop this.
We have managed to achieve diplomatic independence. Now is the time to celebrate!
The Scots have overly influenced our trade, and have supported seperatists and pretenders within our country. We must stop this.
The Scots have overly influenced our trade, and have supported seperatists and pretenders within our country. We must stop this.
The Scots have overly influenced our trade, and have supported seperatists and pretenders within our country. We must stop this.
With our efforts in solving the major causes that have stopped us from fulfilling our promises to our people and chiefs, we can now give our people what they deserve. This will cost, however.

The tensions between us and our minor chiefs has grown too great to manage. At this point, every village has their own claimant to the Tsonga legacy. Peaceful consolidation is now seemingly impossible, best we can do now is prepare for war.
War has come. Thie chief of Zumbo has risen up against our rule, supported by the Scots, and more are likely to follow. Tsonga has fallen, but it will rise once more.
The current dynasty lives on! §GKariba can also be chosen through this path.
Bulawayo seems nice this time of year.
Our Tsonga overlords have collapsed under their own weight. It is time for Mthwakazi to chose its own destiny.
We will not abandon our roots!
The bandits in our north have revolted, we are yet to know their motives, but this can't be good for us.
The region of Hwange has revolted under the Kariban banner.
Kariba is at a crossroad. We could either claim rulership of the Tsonga, or we could stick to our roots, and revolt for our people. What should we do?
The Tsonga throne will be ours!
Our brothers across the rivers have joined our cause! We will be victorius!
Intervene in the Tsonga civil war
The Tsonga civil war presents an oppurtunity for expansion. Should we take it?
With our conquest of the Nyasan homeland, their king has fled past the lake.
We are in control of the core of Tsonga. It is time to take the mantle of the old empire.
We have grown in strength, and are now capable of expanding our confederation across the lake.
Word has spread of a Scot overstepping his boundries, spreading new ideas among us and our people. He should be of no worry, however.
The Mad Scot Attempts a Coup
Remember that guy? Yeah, he's attempting to coup the monarchy in the name of Scotland. What should be the aftermath of the attempt?
The civil war was bloody and devastating, but is over now. We must rebuild.
We must expand past the Zambezi to secure our northern position.
We must conquer Nyasa to secure our position.
We must claim the land held by our Mifangaro brothers.
Drought, poor farming habits, or war have caused insufficient food supplies to feed our people.
A dried up old traveller has returned from the wilderness. When given a whiskey he says with a hoarse voice 'The mountains! They shine with unimaginable wealth!'
Tiormachd is on the outskirts of our control in New Rubha. It shouldn't be difficult to fully annex the region under our colonial administration.
Sitichetir is a small town on the outskirts of what one would consider New Rubha. The people there would be glad if we were to annex the region and offer some protection.
The settlers north of Heidtoun have long been connected to the colony proper. It is time to fully integrate them.
Now that we have solidified control in Mongu, we can annex Mavinga.
With ever-growing powers all around the region, it has become increasingly obvious that our brothers in the north would be more than happy to cooperate with us, securing their freedom.
The Mifangaro, while different in many ways, are still malagasy. We should come to recognize this.
Our elders and advisers have suggested that we send a gift to another country. This could be an oppurtunity for an alliance.
$FROMCOUNTRY$ has sent us large sums of wealth, in hopes of improving relations.
Our elders and advisers have shone resentment towards another people. Perhaps we should show them how we feel?
The bastards in $FROMCOUNTRY$ have insulted us and our people.
Our warriors are begging to invade another country, and receive tribute. Should we allow them?
$PROVINCENAME$ has been lucky with our harvests this year. We can expect higher birth rates and much lower death rates in the region for the following months.
$PROVINCENAME$ has been unlucky with harvests this year. We can expect starvation and death in the region for this following months.
There has been recent debate between our advisers as to how our surplus resources should be spent. What should we decide upon?
European Traders have entered our land have offered to sell as munitions, for a hefty price. Do we accept?
With almost no resistence, the north has been occupied.
With the annexation of the Batswana core, the ruling monarchy has fled north and has re-established A Tswana Kingdom.

The Senque river shows prime conquering potential. The region is in chaos due to the incoming settlers, with no strong central authority. The logistics of the conquest and maintenance will be difficult, but managable.
We must first occupy the region before integrating it. This can be easily achieved, but still, must be achieved.
The Khoikhoi are in dire need of our guidance in this ever-changing world. We must conquer and integrate the land befoe any other powers get to.
The Sotho, Pedi and Tswana have much in common, both in language and in foreign threats. It would be best if we were to unite under one ruler. Ours.
Coastal Zululand has the perfect climate for growing sugar, and plenty of labour. It would be foolish not to import the crop immediately.

With the large sugar plantations, and reports of coal in the mountains, Ulundi would be a perfect location for a rum distillery. This will not only bring profit, but will also help with the modernisation of the region.

Litema, also spelled as ditema, is a form of Sotho mural art composed of decorative and symbolic geometric patterns, commonly associated with Sesotho and Sepedi tradition practised in Basotho and Bapedi. Women create litema on the outer walls and inside of homes by means of engraving, painting, relief mouldings and mosaic. Typically, the geometric patterns are combed or scratched into the wet top layer of fresh clay and dung plaster of the wall, and later painted with earth ochers. Patterns most often mimic ploughed fields through a combed texture, or the patterns refer to plant life, and more occasionally to other aspects of the natural world, such as referring to a clan totem animal. It is common for women of an entire village to apply litema on such special occasions as a wedding or a religious ceremony.
As we no longer neighbour our overlord, it will be easy to declare independence.

The change has been gradual, but noticeable. Litema mural art has evolved past the point of showing just vague concepts, such as marriage or birth, but is now being used to tally crop yields and weapons, display stories and conversations, and even tell jokes. Litema, at least for the $COUNTRY_ADJ$, is not just an art form, it is a syllabary. How this will effect our future, we are yet to know, but it can only be positive.

The newly-developed syllabry greatly suits our language and needs, and it is somewhat recognizable to our people. It would be logical to adopt it as fast as possible. §RFirst civilization progress is 5%, second 10%, third 15%
